00108 /* *******************************************************************************************************************
00109  * replies to signal, and action requests; and informs you if the action was successful. note that if there was a
00110  * protocol-type error while performing the action, that will be reported here if it was an error with the service
00111  * itself; but reported as an ERROR if, for instance, the service didn't exist, or other controller-level error
00112  * occured. |----|-|----|<msg...>|
00113  * ****************************************************************************************************************** */
00114 #define UPK_V0_RESULT_REPL_T_FIELDS \
00115     upk_repl_msgtype_t      msgtype; \
00116     bool                    successful; \
00117     uint32_t                msg_len; \
00118     char                   *msg
00119 
00120 /* *******************************************************************************************************************
00121  * These will be wrapped in PREAMBLE...COMMIT sequences |----|----|<svc_id...>|
00122  * ****************************************************************************************************************** */
00123 #define UPK_V0_LISTING_REPL_T_FIELDS \
00124     upk_repl_msgtype_t      msgtype; \
00125     uint32_t                svc_id_len; \
00126     char                   *svc_id
00127

00150                                                            /* domain socket; but to keep this network safe, I'm going */ \
00151                                                            /* to go ahead and serialize it the same as everything else */ \
00152     v0_svcinfo_t            svcinfo; \
00153     uint32_t                svc_id_len; \
00154     char                   *svc_id

00173 /* *******************************************************************************************************************
00174  * |---| This just serves as an unsolicited reply marker; which is then followed by a repl sequence wrapped up in
00175  * seq_start/seq_end packets.
00176  * ****************************************************************************************************************** */
00177 #define UPK_V0_PUBLICATION_T_FIELDS \
00178     upk_pub_msgtype_t       msgtype
00179

00181  * |---| This just serves as an unsolicited reply marker; which notifies the client that something they subscribed to

00183  * ****************************************************************************************************************** */
00184 #define UPK_V0_CANCELATION_T_FIELDS \
00185     upk_pub_msgtype_t       msgtype
